channel.title: Server Players Online :O
channel.description:
Hey Mopar,
I was wondering if anyone knows how to make the number of players online appear on my website..
(its html btw)

@CPUsquad wrote:

still need this ^^ i tried what others said… no go

Read full topic

item.title: Server Players Online :O
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

Use the COUNT() aggregate function instead because MyISAM tables already cache the count.

PS: Judging by the way this looks, this would return how many users are registered in your database rather than who is online. There are tons of ways to doing this, connecting a socket to the server,. storing a “setting” record in the database for an active player count; which a cache would be great for in this situation.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Players Online :O
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:12, topic:452590”]This should solve the problem of getting it;

<?php
$username = "youruser";
$password = "yourpass";
$database = "yourdatabase";
$host = "localhost"; //99% of the time it's localhost

$handle = mysql_connect($host, $username, $password);

$found = mysql_select_db($database, $handle);

if ($found) {

            $SQL = "SELECT `ID` FROM `players` ORDER BY `ID` DESC LIMIT 1";
            $result = mysql_query($SQL);
            $field = mysql_fetch_assoc($result);

            echo "<h5><center>There are currently <b>" . $field['ID'] . "</b> players online!</center></h5>";

mysql_close($handle);
}
else {
echo "Database wasn't found, check your variables.";
}
?>

I wrote that for displaying accounts created, you may need to change the $SQL variable.[/quote]

Why wouldn’t he just use ‘COUNT(*)’? This is not a valid solution. Or just one that is simple and easy to comprehend.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Players Online :O
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

This should solve the problem of getting it;

<?php
$username = "youruser";
$password = "yourpass";
$database = "yourdatabase";
$host = "localhost"; //99% of the time it's localhost

$handle = mysql_connect($host, $username, $password);

$found = mysql_select_db($database, $handle);

if ($found) {

            $SQL = "SELECT `ID` FROM `players` ORDER BY `ID` DESC LIMIT 1";
            $result = mysql_query($SQL);
            $field = mysql_fetch_assoc($result);

            echo "<h5><center>There are currently <b>" . $field['ID'] . "</b> players online!</center></h5>";

mysql_close($handle);
}
else {
echo "Database wasn't found, check your variables.";
}
?>

I wrote that for displaying accounts created, you may need to change the $SQL variable.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Players Online :O
item.dc:creator: @CPUsquad CPUsquad
item.description:
@CPUsquad wrote:

[quote=“Whackatre, post:10, topic:452590”][quote author=CPUsquad link=topic=555467.msg4072547#msg4072547 date=1344484801]

wat.

It’s not html.

HTML’s merely a mark-up language my friend.

There’s like 3 tutorials on this in the server tutorials section, please look there.

(facepalm)… the website coding is HTML… ofcourse the players online isnt … lol even the noobs know that and SINISOUL thats what i call sexy thanks but i need the code for the players online to be displayed… i understand the part where it looks at the sql db but what would be the html code to display it after looking at the DB
[/quote]

HTML for dynamic pages? I don’t think so.
You can use PHP to echo the variable after you fetch it from the dB:

echo 'Players Online: ' . $var; [/quote]

Thats the thing… i dont know how to fetch it with php cause i basically use html for my basic website layout i could use snippets or sumtin

Read full topic

item.title: Server Players Online :O
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:5, topic:452590”] CREATE TABLE #{YOUR PREFIX HERE}_players (id INT NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY, username CHAR(32))

Then when someone logs in

INSERT INTO #{YOUR PREFIX HERE}_players (username) VALUES (#{USERNAME OF PLAYER})

On log out

DELETE FROM #{YOUR PREFIX HERE}_players WHERE username=#{USERNAME OF PLAYER}

Then to get the count of players online

SELECT COUNT(*) FROM #{YOUR PREFIX HERE}_players

MySQL connector: http://dev.mysql.com/downloads/connector/j/

Website also holds tutorials on how to use it.[/quote]

why wouldn’t you just poll the server directly? SOCKET the server do some sort of authentication grab the details you want close connection.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Players Online :O
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

CREATE TABLE #{YOUR PREFIX HERE}_players (id INT NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY, username CHAR(32))

Then when someone logs in

INSERT INTO #{YOUR PREFIX HERE}_players (username) VALUES (#{USERNAME OF PLAYER})

On log out

DELETE FROM #{YOUR PREFIX HERE}_players WHERE username=#{USERNAME OF PLAYER}

Then to get the count of players online

SELECT COUNT(*) FROM #{YOUR PREFIX HERE}_players

MySQL connector: http://dev.mysql.com/downloads/connector/j/

Website also holds tutorials on how to use it.

Read full topic
